This seems to be caused by a recent change to DefaultPartPresentation. If a tab
is selected that is not initially visible, the tab is moved to the start...
however when the tab is removed, this is firing a selection change event that
ultimately causes a different tab to be selected.

Fixed in head (for 4:00 RC1 submission)

Code inspected by michael and hanna

This was related to the fix for bug 62845. The presentation was removing and
reinserting tabs in order to rearrange them, and when the tab being moved
happened to be the active tab, this was causing a selection change.

Added checks to explicitly ignore any selection change fired by CTabFolder that
didn't originate from a user event.

Note: besides the test failure, if you try to manually reproduce the steps being
tested in the suite (go to the Drag Test Perspective, maximize the stack
containing the problems view, then drag it to the right of the editor area), you
are unable to select the properties view from the chevron. This patch fixes this
issue as well.
Verified on WinXP on I200405281600, and GTK 2.4.0
